summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Dallas Board of Adjustment (Panel C) is convening on December 11, 2023, with a briefing at 10:30 A.M. followed by a public hearing at 1:00 P.M. The meeting will take place at Dallas City Hall, 6ES, and will also be accessible via videoconference. The purpose of the meeting is to address various zoning variance requests and to review administrative matters.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The agenda includes a staff presentation, a public hearing for testimony, and the approval of the 2022-2023 Board of Adjustment Annual Report and minutes from the previous meeting. The case docket will cover both uncontested and individual items requiring decisions.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals include multiple requests for variances to off-street parking and front-yard setback regulations from various applicants. Notable cases include applications from Pedro Montoya, Juan Lopez, and Christopher Williams, among others, seeking adjustments to zoning requirements. Additionally, there are appeals regarding the denial of work certificates for properties on Mercedes Avenue and Monte Vista Drive.

**Action Items**:  
The Board is seeking approval for the annual report and minutes, as well as decisions on the variance requests and appeals listed in the docket. Public testimony will be taken into account before any decisions are made. Participants wishing to speak must register by December 10, 2023.
